question: Using powers enshrined in Articles 2 and 3 of the Constitution, the parliament can do which of the following?
option1: Admit new territories as new state of India
option2: Split or merge existing Indian states
option3: Alter the names and boundaries of existing Indian States
explanation: A new State can be created under Article 2 of the Constitution of India. Under Article 3 the Parliament also has the power to increase, diminish the area of any State or alter the boundary or name of State.
